intro: Chrysanthemum leucanthemum var. autumnale, commonly known as the autumn chrysanthemum, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center, blooming in late summer to early autumn. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with finely divided, gray-green leaves. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden borders and cottage gardens. Its ornamental value is complemented by its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
